This is done to prevent d5 however it does leave a hole on d4 and a potential problem, the backward pawn on d3. The backward pawn is not weak right now because the d file is closed.

interesting move. If white plays Nxe5 then dxe5 and the d3 pawn would then be exposed to attack. If that doesn't happen black can also consider capturing the knight on f3 (best placed minor piece). Or move to c6 to put more control on the hole on d4.
a fresh target is created on d3. keep in mind the double pawns are not bad in this position.
